instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when starting up and board gets super hot
threads.message: Clan board, I already replaced <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> with a 330 larger one and same problem, I also put new thermal paste as old one was crusty, any other pointers?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when starting up and board gets super hot
threads.message:
Do you mean <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>?

Install gfxcardstatus and switch to iGPU.
See if still gets hot.
Also use HWMonitor to check all the temps.

Worth to run corresponding EFI ASD too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when starting up and board gets super hot
threads.message: Sure, but the computer shuts down even before the OS loads, so no go...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when starting up and board gets super hot
threads.message:
You cannot run ASD EFI version?
Does it turn off even if you stop it in boot menu?
